revised_title: The Effect of Carbohydrates and Neutralizing Agents on Nitrogen Fixation by Aerobic Organisms
tldr: The study investigates the influence of different carbohydrates and neutralizing agents on nitrogen fixation by aerobic organisms, specifically Azotobacter and Pseudomonas. Dextrin is found to be an effective source of energy for both organisms, and basic slag proves to be a better neutralizing agent than chalk, with a stimulative effect on nitrogen fixation nearly equal to that of humus.
